headers.subject: [Kde-bindings] Compile just smokeqt4?
headers.received: from unknown (HELO rv-out-0506.google.com) (209.85.198.238) by ktown.kde.org with SMTP; 14 Jul 2008 02:50:20 -0000
by rv-out-0506.google.com with SMTP id g37so4393502rvb.23 for <Kde-bindings@kde.org>; Sun, 13 Jul 2008 19:49:27 -0700 (PDT)
headers.reply-to: KDE bindings for other programming languages <kde-bindings@kde.org>
headers.list-id: KDE bindings for other programming languages <kde-bindings.kde.org>

body.para: Do I have to have KDE4 to compile smokeqt4? It seems like it's just a cmake problem. Even with -DENABLE_SMOKEKDE=off, I still get errors: $ cmake -DENABLE_SMOKE=on -DENABLE_SMOKEKDE=off . CMake Error at /usr/local/share/cmake-2.6/Modules/FindKDE4.cmake:35 (MESSAGE): ERROR: Could not find KDE4 kde4-config Call Stack (most recent call first): CMakeLists.txt:7 (find_package)

And I can't tell what things I can -D to modify where cmake looks for things. Is there a way other than modifying your path to tell cmake where to find Qt? The readme lists some, but it doesn't seem to be complete.
